Ok... I am not. Actually, not at all. But I want to respect that. I am really trying to work with you here.
I don’t understand what is not working with regard to our parenting plan. We just had an agreement to go discuss something today and she went
wildly off scope it sounds like..
I think that is OK I am just disappointed that she’s not being honest about it . And I get your perspective totally. But it does not change the fact that I
want to work with you and understand how I can be a good dad.
But I will step back. I hope we can touch base later tonight. Thank you for the thoughtful consideration.
Please tell Max I am still working on this. But it is very difficult.

Sent:02/10/2024 at 05:57 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/10/2024 at 07:39 PM)
Subject:Re: Really Password...
Message 1323 of 4024
This OFW thing is fine for settled business. When you need to swap pick up plans. What we are trying to do right now is way bigger, and will have a
permanent impact on our children’s future and how you and I treat other for a lifetime.
Please consider a one time peaceful discussion. I’d be happy to go for a walk, do teams, or phone call. I know we have things we need to work around,
but we could do the Bellevue park circle or a place of your choosing. Whatever works.
But we are kidding ourselves that this format will do us any justice at all. We know it does not work. Let’s try something that has for us in the past.
Hell. I even sold and bought a house in one day after one of our more contentious walks!
In my mind we really are not far apart. Mainly because I’m willing to do whatever you like to feel comfortable. I’m honestly open to ideas and trust
“most” of your judgement. We have been through the wringer. Let’s compromise.
Let’s take this back. I showed last week I’m done fighting. Let’s start putting our energy into healthy kids, your job, and my job search. We really don’t
need to wake up to ground hog day with every sunrise. I am dying for normalcy.
You said you’d consider it. Let’s do it. I know you well enough to believe in you. And I just need a shot to show you who I am now. What we’re doing
is not working. The kids need healthy parents. Let’s just do it. If we miss failure, we can always do this again.
You tell me the time &!place. I’ll have my walking shoes warmed up and bring you cofeve.
Sent:02/10/2024 at 06:12 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/10/2024 at 07:39 PM)
Subject:Realistic Expectations
Message 1324 of 4024
He asked if he can come over to watch the Super Bowl tomorrow. He is dying to see the house he chose, furnished. Both the boys are pleasers so he
wants me to ask you. I think he is concerned about doing something he feels like may disappoint you.
Given that he wants it. Dr Brown will not offer an opinion, and there is no harm that will come from it, would you mind asking him like you did for
the Alabama game? I trust that you will do it in a way that makes him feel comfortable. I trust you completely.
Given zero help from Dr Brown except for her helpful insight for me. That I will take to heart and find healthy moments to explore his concerns, I
think we are kind of now at a point where you and I need to decide. And possession is 9/10 of the law.
So I’d like to have him over. The alternative is pick some random date in the next few weeks when nothing has changed. It will be like all of last month
all over again for us. Or we wait weeks/months to try and do something big and formal like for Max.
Sent:02/10/2024 at 07:24 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/10/2024 at 07:38 PM)
Subject:Adrian

I will do that if it’s the only choice of course. But I think he and I would be better served spending time together and letting him direct conversations
as he has started to do. It gives him a voice I encourage. I can hear the relief in his voice when I thank him.
So given today, after a month with zero progress, I think if we aren’t careful, we are doomed to an eternal “just over the next hill” purgatory. I trust
you. Please trust Adrian. Please trust me. Please give him the choice to decide to spend time with me or not.
Plus... he really, really, wants his Nike Tech
Message 1325 of 4024
We are both pretty stoked for it!

Message 1328 of 4024
So... I sent them a group text. I apologized for the digital footprint mail. Said they have every right to be mad at me. And I understood that when they
were acting nice. it was only to not hurt my feelings.
Sent:02/10/2024 at 09:24 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/11/2024 at 07:46 AM)
Subject:Re: Adrian

Thanked them for being kind. Told them it’s ok to feel mad at me and let them know that now I understand, so I’ll step away. When they feel
comfortable I will be here. I am their dad, and I’m always there for them.
So with that, I assume there is no longer a need for a parenting plan. If I’m fighting so hard to see them but they don’t want to see me, it doesn’t make
any sense. I can’t force them to love me, so I’m going to stop.
I assume that will end 90% of our fights and give you what you want (and actually have already taken) I hope I did that in a healthy way. Everything
changed when you said AD doesn’t want to be with me.
Please let me know if you need anything and same as for the boys, I’ll be there for you. I understand why you all hate me now, so I’ll stop being your
burden. You are all free. No more Dad! I wish you the best.
Message 1329 of 4024
Adrians feelings are about trust.
He is skiing today so his response will be delayed. I am monitoring his arm.

Hey!
Hope you are having a good day and starting the week on your front foot. Just wanted to touch base given a long list of things (mostly kid related
topics) that I would like to touch base on with you.
I shared several related emails over the weekend that went unanswered. You might be too busy or are just choosing not to reply. That is honestly none
of my business. But I did comply with the OFW ask.
So, in the spirt of healthy cooperation I’ll send one more to see if you would like to - continue using OFW despite it not working, arrange for a way to
peacefully communicate, or move to expensive lawyers.
I am trying hard to recognize your concerns and anticipate a response of “it’s too much to even reply”. But I am using OFW as asked, and when you
don’t reply, I agree. It’s a lot, now we are backed up.
I’m also disappointed that we keep adopting the guidelines you and Anna Lisa dictate, and since October our relationship and co-parenting has
Sent:02/12/2024 at 11:42 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/12/2024 at 11:55 AM)
Subject:Touch Base

devolved into acrimony and contempt.
I know what’s in it for Anna Lisa, but you’re the mother of our family. And despite how this is positioning your mediation strategy, imho, we are
doing life long damage to the kids and frankly you.
I anticipate a response that it’s all my fault. That’s fine. It is. Our entire marriage was my fault, the kids are my fault, and we never had a nice day in 29
wasted years. But I still want to unwind our disaster peacefully.
So.... I’m asking in a hopeful way in the spirt of healthy co-parents, how we communicate moving forward. The prescribed method isn’t  working and
gets worse every day as asks go ignored.
Thanks!
- robert
Message 1332 of 4024

Yes I agree there are items we should circle back on.
Your list probably covers all my items but please feel free to kick off.
Hope your day has started well too Robert.

Thank you for the prompt and kind reply.
I can start list and share beforehand. My concern is for some of these things we could spend 20 minutes talking to reach an agreement or a week going
back and forth here. For each of ~five issues?
It’s not meant to be a criticism but a simple acknowledgement that when four hours pass before you can afford a reply, an exchange that should take
5-10 minutes usually takes more than 5-10 hours.
My hope is we can:
- Start with a list here (OFW)
- Both share our thoughts (email?)
- Agree to discuss peacefully (tbd?)
- Peacefully agree/disagree
- Document our decisions (OFW)
- Expedite our existing backlog
If we can agree, I will start the list today. We can swap our first thoughts (it would be far easier in email for inline comments?). And then have our 1-1
meeting together on Wednesday evening.

From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/12/2024 at 12:52 PM)
Subject:Re: Touch Base

My hope is we will give this one shot to have a talk, never to be repeated if it does not work. My aspiration is it will work, we show grace, resolve our
issues, and establish a blueprint for success.
I’m honestly, and sincerely trying to work with you, Christine. This is not an attempt to manipulate you. It is trying to dig us out of our hole, resolve
big issues, and move forward peacefully with less expense.
Thanks for your thoughtful consideration...
-robert

Subject:Re: Touch Base
Message 1335 of 4024
Of course. I want to do the right thing and so do you. I am happy to start the list here as asked.
Here is what the RO says now:
- The Restrained Person may not text, email, or telephone the Protected Person EXCEPT as
specifically permitted, below:
- The Restrained Person may communicate with the Protected Person via Our Family Wizard
solely for the purpose of co-parenting the parties’ children and/or for communicating regarding
management of shared assets.
- The Restrained Person may also communicate with the Protected Person via email in
communications with third parties to facilitate business concerning their minor children and/or
managing the parties’ shared assets.
As I read this, you have no restrictions on communicating with me. The RO just limits how I contact you.  It also does not prohibit face-to-face
interactions- school events, sports, or a constructive discussion walk or coffee.
Do you read the text above the same way? I just want to be sure we are on the same page before I spend a considerable amount of time documenting
everything with the expectation that we will resolve anything on OFW again.
My fear is that will lead to the same frustration that inspired this ask. My hope is you will exercise your rights so we can work together instead of going
in a circle by kicking off another round of what has always failed as noted below.
I will start the list and share it here. May I also ask you let me know if you will consider my proposal for a one-time, peaceful and constructive all-up
Sent:02/12/2024 at 02:38 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/12/2024 at 02:46 PM)
Subject:Re: Touch Base

conversation as noted below? Not at all trying to manipulate, I'm just trying to avoid the frustration of inevitable failure again with the limitations of
the OFW process before we start.
- Start with a list here (OFW)
- Both share our thoughts (email?)
- Agree to discuss peacefully (tbd?)
- Peacefully agree/disagree
- Document our decisions (OFW)
- Expedite our existing backlog

Sent:02/12/2024 at 02:49 PM

Subject:Re: Touch Base
Message 1337 of 4024
Totally... any chance we can do that today? Respectfully, of course, this discussion has been going on for weeks  and I'd like to start an inline
discussion tomorrow. I assure you I am NOT coming off the rails. Last week's ask of me is the way I plan to live my life from now on.
Just as an FYI below. It should be a pretty simple, straightforward turnaround for Anna Lisa.
The language provided in the restraining order (RO) specifically addresses restrictions on the "Restrained Person" regarding communication with the
"Protected Person." The terms of a restraining order are directed at the behavior of the restrained person to protect the safety and well-being of the
protected person. It does not impose reciprocal restrictions on the protected person's actions unless specified by the court in a mutual restraining
order.
Here’s how the outlined conditions generally apply:

person. These limitations are in place to prevent unwanted or potentially harmful interactions, while still allowing necessary communication for co-
parenting or managing shared assets through specified channels.

is consistent with the purpose of a restraining order, which is to protect one party from the actions of another. However, the protected person is
typically not prevented from contacting the restrained person unless they also have a restraining order against them or there are specific court orders
to that effect.
If both parties need or want to modify the communication terms of the RO—for example, to allow more flexibility or to impose certain restrictions
on the protected person as well—it's essential to do so through the court. Any changes to the terms of a restraining order must be approved by a judge
to be legally enforceable.
In any situation involving a restraining order, consulting with a legal professional can provide guidance tailored to the specifics of the case, including
any questions about communication rights and restrictions for both parties.
Sent:02/12/2024 at 02:58 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/12/2024 at 05:30 PM)
Subject:Re: Touch Base

Message 1338 of 4024
Time & Date in screenshot
Side note... I hope this doesn’t push buttons because it should put you ease. Obviously ADs screen time is more intrusive than the things we had set
up for us.
We had simple things like “joined the network” for anyone (Elsa, Christina, Ms Stephanie... etc) and it never said anyone’s name in the actual alert.
BUT if you drilled into it you could kinda figure it out by looking at the device name- “Ms. Stephanie’ iPhone” and triangulating on the time it fired.
This (when we were a family) was important. You want to know if people are on your family’s network. They can do bad things to work laptops, kids
stuff, etc...
When I was in the fold, I tried hard to keep us all safe. Just like you file our taxes. We did what we know how to do as in an effort to keep the Moyer’s
humming.
BUT!!! The big takeaway for you, is there were NEVER indoor cams. This hint is enough to infer things. So please know your privacy was NEVER
invaded.
I will swear that’s true on my children’s life, Christine.
I don’t want to hurt you. I still love you more than life.

Sent:02/12/2024 at 06:25 PM

Subject:Re: Still getting alerts

Message 1341 of 4024
It’s not a number. That’s either an sms or mms. This is an iOS alert. Just like with the “you know what”incident. Xfinity brokers that handshake with
Apple.
It has nothing to do with ATT. Neither did the other. And it is frustrating. Apple iOS sees a trigger in the cloud and pumps it out to my MAC
address.
Stuff happens in the service and even I don’t always grok the trigger. But in both cases, we know what made those fire. We just don’t know how to
stop it.
It’s not going to kill us as long as I don’t go to jail or loose future employability for it. So as long as we agree I can even stop putting myself in danger.
Just let me know. This is obviously one of the running list items I realized should go through Lisa, but felt like you and I could potentially just
cooperate on.
I want to get back to a place of trust with you. But till then, with Anna Lisa in play, it’s very scary to me. I’ll follow your lead, Christine and hope for
the best.

To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/13/2024 at 10:07 AM)
Subject:Re: Adrian
Message 1357 of 4024
Sorry... I could have been more helpful but did not want to ruin a positive conversation with you.
Now that you have taken the reigns of the Network, however, you see all the stuff I used to see.  It is not intentional, you don't always understand it,
but unwelcome alerts pop up on your phone. I know, it happened to me all the freaking time.
The good news is that Samsung is likely a TV that was out of Wi-Fi range and conditions changed (a door that is usually closed is left open) or it has
not been turned on in a long while (maybe the TV in the man cave?). Then it reconnects, then you get an alert.
The good news is to join the network, it had to have a password at some point. And maybe this was just a TV that has not been joined since you
changed the WiFI name? That can happen. So it's annoying for sure, but probably safe, and not nefarious.
So as mentioned, if you let me know next time, I can teach you how to open an alert, investigate what it is, and have some peace of mind that it should
be there. Some android devices are no help, but Samsung usually has the metadata you need.
Alternatively, perhaps I can screen record simulating the same situation on my phone and share it with you. A picture is worth a thousand words, so a
video is probably worth a book. Divorce is the worst time to have this kind of alert crap happening.
Sent:02/13/2024 at 10:13 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/13/2024 at 12:53 PM)
Subject:Re: Still getting alerts
Message 1358 of 4024
We are waiting on Anna Lisa. That is fine. And I am waiting to formalize my list, so I will run some errands while we wait. BTW- Fernish does NOT
deliver to Kirkland or Bellevue. So I am buying a real cheap kitchen table from World Market ($650).
